definition: to stand as a goalkeeper/to keep guard on a gate
to hold/to contain/to grasp/to take hold of/handle/particle marking the following noun as a direct object/classifier for objects with handle/classifier for small objects: handful

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
lit. General Iron is guarding the door (idiom)/fig. the door is padlocked — nobody inside

sentences.english: She get left her key in the office or get to toce the gate open.
sentences.chinese: 她把钥匙忘在了办公室，只好强行把门打开。

sentences.english: I rang again and a maid with a sullen face opened the door .
sentences.chinese: 我又揿了一下门铃，一名侍女紧绷着脸把门开了。

sentences.english: Please pull the door to when you go out.
Her mother yells: Close the door.
sentences.chinese: 她母亲尖声叫道，“把门关上。”

sentences.english: She opened the door just a crack to listen to the talking.
sentences.chinese: 她把门开了一条缝听人谈话。

sentences.english: Get up, Captain and open the door, and you will find the fog gone.
sentences.chinese: 起来，船主把门打开，你要看见雾已经全消了。

sentences.english: Did you leave the doors and windows firmly fastened?
sentences.chinese: 你把门和窗户关紧了吗？

sentences.english: The two thieves fumbled the door open.
sentences.chinese: 那两个贼笨拙地把门打开。

sentences.english: They burst open the door and marched in.
sentences.chinese: 他们把门冲开，走了进来。

sentences.english: When the door opens, push with your foot.
sentences.chinese: 锁开了之后，再用你的脚把门推开。

sentences.english: Now the hall-boy pounded on the door and he released his hold upon her regretfully.
sentences.chinese: 这时旅馆的茶房把门敲得砰砰响，他遗憾地放开了她。

sentences.english: He slammed the door in a spirit of defiance.
sentences.chinese: 他以挑衅性的态度把门砰地一下关上。

sentences.english: The police battered the door down and rescued the children from the burning house.
sentences.chinese: 警察把门砸坏，于是从那着火的房子里救出了孩子们。

sentences.english: He closed the door softly behind him.
sentences.chinese: 他随手轻轻地把门关上了。

sentences.english: You should lock all the doors and windows, so that burglars can't get in.
sentences.chinese: 你应该把门窗户关好，这样小偷就进不去屋。

definition: variant of 門閂|门闩[men2 shuan1]
to close (a door)/to turn off (light, electrical equipment etc)
locked in (with the door locked from the outside)
horizontal bar to hold a door closed (made of wood or metal)/door bolt
to open a door (lit. and fig.)/to open for business
bolt (for locking a window, cabinet etc)/(electrical) plug
